article.headline: South Alabama 59, Samford 54
article.story: MOBILE, Ala. (AP) -- Demetric Bennett scored 21 points and had 10 rebounds to help lead South Alabama to a 59-54 victory over Samford on Saturday night. South Alabama (5-2) trailed 31-25 at the half, but returned to outscore Samford 34-23 in the second. Jerry Smith led Samford (2-4) with 15 points and Travis Peterson scored 13. Joe Ross Merritt and Randall Gulina each scored 11 points. Carlos Smith rounded out the double digit scoring for South Alabama with 11 points. Samford only shot 11.1 percent from beyond the arc in the final 20 minutes of play as South Alabama rallied for its third-straight home win this season. The Jaguars have won 13-consecutive games against Samford. "It was a tough loss for us tonight," Samford head coach Jimmy Tillette said. "I thought that we had a good chance to win, but we just didn't shoot the ball well in the second half. We played tough in the first half and I thought that we shot better, but we still missed a lot of wide-open shots." The Jaguars went on a critical 14-6 run with the game tied at 45-45 with 5:37 left to play and took a a 59-51 lead.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
